alert.note: Alert for Cherokee (Oklahoma) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued May 04 at 8:06PM CDT until May 06 at 2:26AM CDT by NWS Tulsa
info.description: ...The Flood Warning is extended for the following rivers in Oklahoma... Illinois River at Chewey affecting Adair, Cherokee and Delaware Counties. Illinois River near Tahlequah affecting Cherokee County. Illinois River near Watts affecting Adair and Delaware Counties. ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in Oklahoma... Flint Creek near Kansas affecting Cherokee and Delaware Counties. Baron Fork River at Eldon affecting Cherokee County. ...FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT FROM THURSDAY MORNING TO EARLY FRIDAY MORNING... * WHAT...Minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Baron Fork River at Eldon. * WHEN...From Thursday morning to early Friday morning. * IMPACTS...At 20.0 feet, moderate flooding occurs. Grazing lands near the river become inundated. Low-lying areas near Camp Egan may experience minor flooding. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 7:30 PM CDT Wednesday the stage was 9.8 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise above flood stage tomorrow morning to a crest of 19.5 feet early Thursday afternoon. It will then fall below flood stage Thursday evening. - Flood stage is 18.0 feet. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
